H0.text: The Japanese condiment wasabi is produced from what part of the the wasabi plant. Leaf

H1.text: The Japanese condiment wasabi is produced from what part of the the wasabi plant. Stem

H2.text: The Japanese condiment wasabi is produced from what part of the the wasabi plant. Flower

H3.text: The Japanese condiment wasabi is produced from what part of the the wasabi plant. Root

A4.text: The part used for wasabi paste has been characterized as the rhizome or the stem, or the 'rhizome plus the base part of the stem'.

A5.text: Wasabi is grown for its rhizomes, which are ground into a paste as a pungent condiment for sushi and other foods.

A6.text: Wasabizuke is made of wasabi leaves pickled in sake lees.

A7.text: Some rhizomes that are used directly in cooking include ginger, turmeric, galangal, fingerroot, lotus and wasabi.
